revised_title: Extreme Heat and Health Impacts in July 1757
tldr: In July 1757, John Huxham and Dr. Watson reported extreme heat in England, with temperatures reaching 88°F (31.3°C) in the shade. This heat caused various health issues, including fevers, dysenteries, and haemorrhages. They also mentioned a violent hurricane, a significant earthquake, and a comparison of heat levels with Madeira.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Climate and Weather
